title: Inline Search Container
reference-overview: The Inline Search Container is used whenever you want to present the user with a small, concise search form that will display results immediately below.
reference-usage: Use the Inline Search Container when the user needs to conduct a search limited to a small number of fields on a page or within an application. When the search button is selected, search results will appear below and will not reload the page. The results displayed will be formatted using the Interactive Data Table. This component also allows search results that can be displayed on a different page once the search button is selected.
reference-details:
Form Styles

  • The forms within the Inline Search Container can be either Stacked or Inline.
  • Inline forms within the Inline Search Container can be left or right aligned.

Sizing and Layout

  • Inline Search Container height and width are variable based on inside content and Inline Search Form height and width.
  • The content margins inside all Mercer Inline Search Containers will have 15 pixels of padding all around.
  • The padding inside an Inline Search Container from the line under the Label to the beginning of the actual content or Inline Search Form is also 15 pixels.

Miscellaneous

  • Inline Search Containers work within the Mercer Grid System.
  • Inline Search Containers can contain grids inside of them to display and section off data within the container.
  • Inline Search Containers are created using HTML tags and the Inline Search Form.

Buttons

  • There should only be a single Primary Button.
  • All button related behavior and styling should work as defined on the Buttons component.
reference-mobile:
• For mobile, the inline search container labels stack above the fields.
  • The input fields span the width of the parent container (minus the margins).
  • The "Search" button spans the width of the parent container (minus the margins).
reference-code-html-content-block-pre: All containers start with base box and in this example we are using the following class mul-inline-search-ctn to give more meaning to a basic box.
